title: Emergency Medicine Specialist/Consultant
description: Premium opportunities for UK-trained Emergency Medicine Doctors. Exceptional remuneration, excellent work-life balance, and practice in Australia's most beautiful locations.
fullDescription:
Are you a UK Emergency Medicine Specialist/Consultant looking for a career move that offers exceptional remuneration, an excellent work–life balance, and the opportunity to practice medicine in some of Australia's most beautiful locations?

We have multiple positions available across Queensland (near Brisbane), Victoria (near Melbourne), South Australia (near Adelaide), and Tasmania.

components: Attraction & Retention Incentives (40-50% of base for rural locations)
leave: 4-6 weeks annual leave with 17.5% leave loading
support: Salary packaging options for significant tax savings

responsibilities: Deliver expert clinical care across diverse emergency presentations
Manage both adult and paediatric cases (typically 20-30% paediatric)
Lead and mentor junior doctors
Participate in teaching and educational programs
Contribute to quality improvement and clinical governance initiatives
Support rural/remote sites via telehealth and outreach (some locations)
Involvement in aeromedical retrieval coordination (selected sites)
departments: Mix of tertiary trauma centers and modern regional hospitals
Fast Track areas and Short Stay Units
Digital systems and contemporary clinical environments
Strong multidisciplinary teams with excellent nursing support
requirements: Experience working as an Emergency Medicine Specialist/Consultant in the UK
Strong clinical leadership and decision-making abilities

professional: Modern, well-equipped Emergency Departments with cutting-edge technology
Extensive professional development allowances and protected CPD time (up to 3.6 weeks annually)
Opportunities for teaching, research, and clinical leadership
lifestyle: Sustainable rosters with genuine work-life balance
300+ days of sunshine annually in many locations
Access to world-class beaches, national parks, and outdoor activities

title: Registered Nurses - Multiple Specialties
location: Melbourne, Sydney, Perth, Darwin, Canberra, Auckland
description: Excellent opportunity for Registered Nurses in Critical Care & Emergency, Medical, Surgical, Perioperative, Paediatrics, Community Health, Child & Family Health, and Disability & Rehabilitation. Full visa sponsorship and relocation support included.
fullDescription:
Excellent opportunity for Registered Nurses in Critical Care & Emergency, Medical, Surgical, Perioperative, Paediatrics, Community Health, Child & Family Health, and Disability & Rehabilitation to relocate to Australia.

Work in state-of-the-art medical facilities, earn excellent salaries, enjoy a balanced lifestyle, and receive full visa and relocation support.

Positions are available across major cities and key regions, with roles offered within public metropolitan/urban hospitals as well as select regional healthcare settings. You will work in a modern, well-equipped clinical environment with a supportive, collaborative team culture designed to help you thrive.

components: Additional allowances based on role and location
Salary packaging options for eligible employees
support: Full relocation support packages for eligible overseas appointees
Career development support and structured progression pathways

responsibilities: Deliver comprehensive and safe nursing care across various hospital departments
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop, implement, and evaluate patient care plans
Monitor patient conditions closely and respond promptly to any clinical changes
Administer medications and treatments in accordance with hospital policies and clinical guidelines
Provide compassionate support, education, and reassurance to patients and their families
Maintain accurate, detailed, and timely clinical documentation in line with organisational standards
requirements: 2 to 3 years' nursing experience (depending on visa pathway)
Eligibility for AHPRA registration as a Registered Nurse
Willingness to complete the ANMAC assessment under the relevant ANZSCO code
Strong clinical skills and ability to work in a multidisciplinary team

professional: Access to latest clinical technologies and practices
lifestyle: Live and work in Australia's major cities or regional areas
Access to Australia's outdoor lifestyle and natural beauty

title: Mental Health Nurses and Midwives to Australia
description: Excellent opportunity for Midwives and Mental Health Nurses to relocate to Australia and build a rewarding career in modern, well-supported healthcare environments. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance included.
fullDescription:
Excellent opportunity for Midwives and Mental Health Nurses to relocate to Australia and build a rewarding career in modern, well-supported healthcare environments. Earn excellent salaries, enjoy a strong work–life balance, and receive comprehensive visa and relocation assistance.

Opportunities are available across Sydney, Canberra, Darwin, and Tasmania, offering a mix of vibrant metropolitan settings and welcoming regional communities. Roles are offered within public urban hospitals as well as regional healthcare settings, providing exposure to diverse healthcare environments and a supportive, collaborative workplace culture.

components: Salary packaging options available (up to AUD $10,000 tax-free)
Packages vary depending on employer, role, and location
support: Relocation support including one-way travel expenses
Up to 12 weeks of accommodation assistance
Registered Migration Agent advice and guidance throughout the process
Career growth with ongoing professional development and clear progression pathways

responsibilities: Mental Health Nurses: Belong to a dynamic and well-supported team committed to delivering high-quality mental health services to children, young people, and their families/carers
Mental Health Nurses: Undertake clinical services through assessment, case management, and individual therapies, including the development and implementation of specialised treatment programs
Mental Health Nurses: Collaborate with an amazing and diverse group of clinicians as part of a multidisciplinary team, providing support and consultation when required
Mental Health Nurses: Consult and liaise with the broader health system, including GPs and other agencies, to optimise service effectiveness, efficiency, and continuity of care
Mental Health Nurses: Identify key hospital, community mental health, community sector, and primary health stakeholders, building effective working relationships as required
Midwives: Deliver safe, evidence-based, and compassionate care to women and their families
Midwives: Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to ensure optimal outcomes
Midwives: Support and educate women and their families throughout the childbirth journey
Midwives: Maintain accurate documentation and adhere to clinical guidelines and policies
requirements: Experience in Midwifery or Mental Health Nursing
Eligibility for AHPRA registration as a Midwife or Registered Nurse (Mental Health)
Willingness to complete the ANMAC assessment under the relevant ANZSCO code
Strong clinical skills and ability to work in a multidisciplinary team
Commitment to delivering high-quality patient care

professional: Work in modern, well-supported healthcare environments
Supportive, inclusive, and collaborative team environment
lifestyle: Live and work in vibrant metropolitan or welcoming regional communities
Comprehensive relocation assistance including travel and accommodation
Access to Australia's outdoor lifestyle and natural beauty
